Package MainGameLogic

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
MainGameLogic.GameLogic
public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements an the gameEnvironment which is used to run the main logic. Such as allowing the player to choose what to do like sailing or buying/selling items. It also determines when the game is over.
Version:
1.1, 16 April 2021.
Author:
John Elliott

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    GameLogic()
    Initializes an main MainGameLogic.GameEnvironment which initializes all the Islands, Routes and Stores that will be in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic()
      Initializes an main MainGameLogic.GameEnvironment which initializes all the Islands, Routes and Stores that will be in the game. Along with the initial condition for the player.

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName​(java.lang.String name)
      A set method for the players name.
      Parameters:
      name - The players name.

    • setDays

      public void setDays​(int length)
      A set method for the number of days being played. Also sets daysLeft which decrease during the game.
      Parameters:
      length - The number of game days.

    • getSelectedDays

      public int getSelectedDays()
      A get method for the number of days selected to be played.
      Returns:
      selectedDays The number of selected days.

    • setShip

      public void setShip​(int shipNum)
      A set method for the type of ship that player will use. Take a ship number and initializes the given ship.
      Parameters:
      shipNum - The ship number.

    • checkName

      public boolean checkName​(java.lang.String name)
      Takes a players given name. Then checks to make sure its not using special characters, is longer than 3 but less than 15 characters and has only single white spaces.
      Parameters:
      name - The name entered by the user.
      Returns:
      result A boolean of true if the names valid.

    • getWealth

      public int getWealth()
      A get method for the players current wealth.
      Returns:
      wealth The players wealth.

      Returns:
      daysLeft The days left in the game.

      A get method for the players name.
      Returns:

    • canSail

      public boolean canSail​(int newIslandIndex, int routeRisk)
      Determines if the player can currently afford to sail to the new island.
      Parameters:
      newIslandIndex - The index of the new island.
      routeRisk - The index of the route.
      Returns:
      result A boolean that true if they can pay the wages.

    • canSail

      public boolean canSail​(int islandIndex)
      Determines if the player can currently afford to sail to island on any route between two islands.
      Parameters:
      islandIndex - The index of the new island.
      Returns:
      result A boolean that true if they can pay the wages.

    • sail

      public RandomEvents sail​(int newIslandIndex, int routeRisk)
      Sails the player to a new island but also determines the event that occurs during the journey.
      Parameters:
      newIslandIndex - The index of the new island.
      routeRisk - The index of the route.
      Returns:
      event The event that occurred.

      Returns:

    • buyShipUpgrades

      Given a type will buy a given amount of upgrades and add them to the ship.
      Parameters:

      amount - The amount of new upgrades.

    • getIsland

      public Island getIsland​(int islandIndex)
      Given a islands index will return that island.
      Parameters:
      islandIndex - The islands index.
      Returns:
      island The island for the given index.

    • getGameActive

      public boolean getGameActive()
      Returns the current game status.
      Returns:
      gameActive Current game status.

    • determinePirateGameActive

      public void determinePirateGameActive​(RandomEvents event)
      During the pirate event if the player loses this method is used to determine if the player is allowed to live or not. Meaning if the player doesn't have enough cargo value it is game over.
      Parameters:
      event - Current game status.

    • getRouteInfo

      public java.lang.String getRouteInfo​(int newIsland, int risk)
      Gets information about the a given route.
      Parameters:
      newIsland - The index of the new island.
      risk - The index of the route.
      Returns:
      routeInfo The event that occurred.

    • canContiune

      public boolean canContiune()
      This method checks if the player can from the current island sail to a new island. Checks if the no route is able to be completed before the games over or they all cost to much to be sailed.
      Returns:
      active A boolean thats true if games still active.

    • sellRemainingCargo

      public void sellRemainingCargo()
      Sells all remaining cargo in the ship and updates the wealth of the player. This is used when the game is over to allow the player to get the max score they could.
